item.title: Ideas
item.description: Here are some personal projects I am interested in working on, in no particular order: The Weirdest Things Analyze content tags for front-page news stories of major national newspapers to find the most unusual stories See how or if the subject matter has changed over a period of several years Sans Swagger Use a neural network to create a rap lyric generator Applications of agent-based modeling in financial portfolio analysis Segregation study Use US Census data to rate tracts according to levels of ethnic and racial diversity As well as incomes, noting in Portland MSA the possible impact of professional athletes’ salaries on mean incomes of blacks.

item.title: About
item.description: A Fast-Fish belongs to the party fast to it. A Loose-Fish is fair game for anybody who can soonest catch it. But what plays the mischief with this masterly code is the admirable brevity of it, which necessitates a vast volume of commentaries to expound it. 1 From Chapter 89 of Moby Dick, by Herman Melville↩

item.title: CV
item.description: Ian Davis Portland, OR ian@aloosefish.com Summary of Skills Proficient R, Python, and SQL Programmer three Education Metropolitan State University of Denver 2005-2009 Portland State University, 2017 - present Relevant Coursework Projects Relevant Work Experience Other Work Experience

item.title: The Best and Worst Neighborhoods in Portland
